posts.cooked: Hi I am working on our robot and I want to implement an ultrasonic sensor the one I have is the “ 873M General Purpose Ultrasonic Sensor ” but I can’t find any documentation for it so I wanted to see if anyone had any idea for how I should code this?

There are multiple models.

What are you trying to detect? Is it just the presence of an object or the distance to it?

-There are simpler sensors to use.

I am trying to detect the presence of an object, I am aware of simpler sensors but sadly I don’t have any that would okr for my apilcation and lack the amount of time to order, aren’t those pdfs for the same model?
So I can program it the same way as shown in wpilib? As an analog or a ping response?

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked:
Analog, however, looking at the spec sheet in more detail, there is one big difference that could affect you. IMG_0472 2752×2064 656 KB If it’s a voltage model, you won’t be able to supply it the minimum 15 volts it says it requires.

IMG_0472 2752×2064 656 KB

IMG_0472 2752×2064 656 KB

posts.name: Jim Sokoloff
posts.cooked:
They could get a buck-boost converter that outputs 15 (or up to 24) volts.

I have a feeling that the easier path would be one or more IR proximity sensors (if they only need presence/absence) or LIDAR sensors (if they need ranging as well).

The IR prox sensors directly wire to DIOs and can be read with one line of Java code (two if you need an import). LIDAR are more effort to integrate.

(I haven’t suggested this previously as they seemed dead-set on not buying anything, but if that restriction is removed, I think I’d rather buy an IR prox sensor from Amazon than a buck-boost and try to integrate ultrasonics.)

posts.name: Jim Sokoloff
posts.cooked:
Specifically, in their shoes, I’d order the following Amazon item #1 and Amazon item #2 (both next day available for me here in MA) and have them on-hand as a backup plan at least.

We trialed both and used the second style on our bot this year, but both styles are trivial to integrate.
I’ll look into it I have competition in two days but I might have som arduino stuff that might work.

posts.name: Chris LaSalle
posts.cooked: You can make or purchase a voltage divider for the signal path to the roborio.

Could I use something like this if so how? IMG_2083 4032×3024 2.44 MB (Edit) Found the docs haven’t gotten working yet but will try.

IMG_2083 4032×3024 2.44 MB

link_counts.title: Proximity Switches - Hardware — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Jim Sokoloff
posts.cooked:
That looks like the #2 IR prox device I linked above.

If so, take a 3 pin DIO on the Rio, send 5V to Vcc, GND to GND, S to digital out (ignore the analog out pin), adjust the potentiometer to have the sensitivity you want and read the DigitalInput in software .

If the 4 pins are “Vcc, GND, Dout, and Aout”, wire it like the Photoelectric Proximity Switches on that page. If they’re not (or you’re not sure), post a pic with the pins’ labels showing, so we can help you get it wired up.
